intro: Alternanthera achyranth, commonly known as red-veined sorrel, is a herbaceous plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking red-veined leaves that contrast with its green or purple foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers moist, well-drained soil. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens and containers due to its vibrant leaf coloration. Alternanthera achyranth is a perennial in tropical climates but is often grown as an annual in cooler regions.
